title: How to roll back ONT firmware for ZX-900 series
author: L2 Support Team
content:
Issue

Customers with ZX-900 ONTs on firmware v3.14.2 may experience intermittent connection drops (link flaps).

Cause

A regression in the firmware v3.14.2 is the root cause. A hotfix is pending.

Resolution

The approved interim solution is to roll back the firmware to the last stable version (v3.12.9).

  1. Verify the issue by running a line test. Look for an excessive number of link flaps in the diagnostic output.
  2. Inform the customer about the necessary rollback and the brief service interruption.
  3. Use the 'Execute Firmware Rollback' quick action in the agent desktop. This triggers an API call to the provisioning system.
  4. After the action completes (approx. 5-10 minutes), run the line test again to confirm the link is stable.
  5. Confirm with the customer that the service is restored.
